three.A: <slap the other speaker> I'm the one asking the questions here!

number.Q: What did the paper say to the pen?'
What do you call a fake noodle?
What's the difference between a politician and a church bell?
number.A: A church bell peals from the steeple.

number.Q: Why does the Crimini get invited to all the parties?
Where do you find a zebra?
number.A: 25 letters over from the A, brah!

number.Q: How can you tell if someone went to Harvard?
How many hipsters does it take to screw in a lightbulb?
number.A: <mutter and look away> It's a pretty obscure number -- you probably haven't heard of it.

number.Q: How many hippies does it take to change a lightbulb?
Why did the Communist drink only herbal tea?
How do you fit an elephant into a grocery bag?
number.A: Take the 's' out of 'safe' and the 'f' out of 'way'.

number.Q: Why do pirates bury treasure 11 inches in the ground?
number.A: Because booty is only shin deep.

number.Q: What time is your dental appointment?

one-liners.OL: Find me Trotsky's grave and I show you Communist plot.
A horse walks into a bar. The bartender says, 'Why the long face?'
Two fish are sitting in a tank. One turns to the other and says, 'Do you know how to drive this thing?'
So a guy walks into a bar proclaiming he's a pirate so the bartender says, 'If you're a pirate, where are your Buccaneers?' And the man answers 'On my bucking head.'
You hear about the new fusion Chinese-German place? The food's good, but an hour later you're hungry for power.
Two peanuts were walking down the street. One was assaulted.
